questions.question: 7. When to use derived state?
questions.subject: react
options: Whenever the state should not trigger a re-render
Whenever the state can be synchronized with an effect
Whenever the state should be accessible to all components
Whenever the state can be computed from another state variable

questions.question: 8. What triggers a UI re-render in React?
questions.subject: react
options: Adding event listeners to DOM elements

questions.question: 9. When do we directly "touch" the DOM in React?
questions.subject: react
options: When we need to listen to an event
When we need to change the UI
When we need to add styles

questions.question: 10. In what situation do we use a callback to update state?
questions.subject: react
options: When updating the state will be slow
When the updated state is very data-intensive
When the state update should happen faster
When the new state depends on the previous state

questions.question: 11. If we pass a function to useState, when will that function be called?
questions.subject: react
options: Each time we update the state
The first time we update the state

questions.question: 12. Which hook to use for an API request on the component's initial render?

questions.question: 13. Which variables should go into the useEffect dependency array?
questions.subject: react
options: All state and props referenced in the effect
All variables needed for clean up

questions.question: 14. An effect will always run on the initial render.
questions.subject: react
options: It depends on the dependency array
In depends on the code in the effect

questions.question: 15. When will an effect run if it doesn't have a dependency array?
questions.subject: react
options: The first time the component re-renders
Each time the component is re-rendered
